intro: Protium buenaventurense, commonly known as the Buenaventura Protium, is a tropical tree native to the Caribbean island of Hispaniola. It belongs to the family Sapindaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are often elliptical in shape. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in panicles, followed by oval, woody fruits containing single seeds. Its botanical features make it an important species in the ecological systems of its native habitat.
